F600.title: Freedom from Abuse, Neglect, and Exploitation
F600.definition: Facility must protect residents from abuse, neglect, exploitation, and misappropriation.

F550.title: Resident Rights (General)
F550.definition: Facilities must protect and promote each residentâ€™s rights, including dignity, self-determination, participation in care, and communication/access.
surveyFocus: Access to representatives and grievance process

F689.title: Accident Hazards / Supervision / Devices
F689.definition: Residents must be free from accident hazards and receive adequate supervision and assistive devices to prevent accidents.

F880.title: Infection Prevention and Control
F880.definition: Facilities must establish and maintain an infection prevention and control program to provide a safe, sanitary, and comfortable environment and help prevent development and transmission of disease and infection.

F580.title: Notification of Changes
F580.definition: Facilities must notify the resident, representative, and physician of significant changes, accidents/incidents, or as required.

F758.title: Free From Unnecessary Psychotropic Medications
F758.definition: Psychotropic medications must not be used unless necessary to treat a specific documented condition; gradual dose reductions and non-pharmacologic interventions are required unless clinically contraindicated.

F842.title: Medical Records - Content
F842.definition: Clinical records must be complete, accurately documented, readily accessible, and systematically organized.

F887.title: COVID-19 (as applicable) / Infection Control
F887.definition: Facilities must implement infection control requirements specific to COVID-19 and other respiratory pathogens when applicable.

F881.title: Antibiotic Stewardship Program
F881.definition: Facilities must develop and implement an antibiotic stewardship program that includes protocols and monitoring to promote appropriate antibiotic use.
